Cardiac Output (Q)

Cardiac Output (Q)

Important physiological equations:

Q =venous return : the heart pumps harder if more blood flows into it ( Frank-Starling mechanism ). In health, what goes in must come out.

Q=SV*HR : mathematically correct, but physiologically misleading. Electrical pacing an animal heart yeilds constant cardiac output between 50 and 200 bpm.

Q=ΔP/SVR : Ohm’s law. Always true, but remember that SVR is a composite measure of many different factors, including arteriolar resistance, viscosity
